result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Q Batton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: count 5

Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: count 5

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription. Take all medications as prescribed and follow all doctor's orders.

Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Any assessments, counseling or  treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Joseph Q Batton in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Defendant Joseph Q Batton in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense has been working on getting information on the mental health situation. Ms. Hall has a bag of meds that have been filled and she has had the deft fill out numerous releases. Ms. Hall indicates that in speaking with Milwaukee Health Complex that there could be three different places that have records. The State indicates that her concern is that none of the meds are psychotropic meds and many of them are from 2011. The State questions how necessary some of these medications are for the deft as they are past 5 years old.

BTC: The Court leaves the decision of bond modification open. The Court wants a physician/psychiatrist to testify that the deft is not receiving proper care here. Ms. Hall raises competency
  Competency hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing on March 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Def is asking for $2,500.00 cash and a co-signature component.Rosie Batton, 04-19-1937. The State objects to further modification of bond - argument put on the record

BTC: The Court will reserve ruling. The Court wants defense to obtain a statement from the deft's physician's .  Review hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Ct 1: 961.41(1m)(h)2-Poss w/intent THC; Ct 2: 961.42(1)-Maintain Drug Trafficking Place; Ct 3: 941.29(2)(a)-Felony Possess Firearm; Ct 4: 961.41(1m)(h)1-Poss w/intent THC; cT 5: 961.42(1)-Maintain Drug Trafficking Place; Cts 6 & 7: 941.29(2)(a) Felon Possess Firearm. No contact with the co-defendant, JSW.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. ** Amended 7-9-2015 to include no contact with KN

AMENDED 02-12-2016: DEFENDANT MUST TAKE ANY CURRENTLY PRESCRIBED PSYCHOTROPIC MEDICATIONS

Defendant Joseph Q Batton in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Defendant Joseph Q Batton in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for Sharon Riek for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.
Defense files bond motion requesting bond be modified to $10,000.00 cash. Defense has had deft sign an authorization allowing her to receive his medical records. The State feels the motion is a bit premature as there a number of unknowns and the mental health matter is not substantiated at this time. The State objects to modification at this time.

BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond to be modified to $10,000.00. Same terms and conditions as previously ordered remain. Deft must take any currently prescribed psychotropic medications.
